com.googlecode.rockit.app.solver

Class StandardSolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.rockit.app.solver.AbstractSolver
      • com.googlecode.rockit.app.solver.StandardSolver

  • public class StandardSolver
extends AbstractSolver
    Solves the MAP Query. After initializing the sql and ilp connectors, we create all neccessary SQL statements with the method 'determineFormulasToCheck'. Then, the method solve() starts the process. After calling StandardGrounder.ground(), it basically calls runCuttingPlaneInference, which may also only perform one CPI iteration (adding all constraints).
    Author:
    Jan

      • solve

        public ArrayList<String> solve()
                        throws SolveException,
                               ParseException
        Specified by:
        solve in class AbstractSolver
        Parameters:
        model -
        Returns:
        A list of variables which are true in the current setting.
        Throws:
        ReadOrWriteToFileException - This method solves the marcov logic network using Integer Linear Programming. As input it needs a grounding of every restriction and objective formula like it is done in the standard evaluator. Its output is a list of variables which are true in the solution.
        ParseException
        SolveException

      • runCuttingPlaneInference

        public ArrayList<String> runCuttingPlaneInference()
                                           throws SolveException,
                                                  ParseException
        Belongs to solve procedure. Excluded because this is needed also by other solving techniques like the Exact k boundend map inference method. Initially, it puts the evidence and the ground formulas with only one literal and weigt > 0 into the ILP. In each iteration, it solves the ILP, puts the result into the table, computes grounded clauses, and adds (violated) constraints to the ILP.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        SolveException
        ParseException
        ReadOrWriteToFileException
